meanings.sent1: I consume a delicious apple every morning for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: It is important to consume a balanced diet for good health.
meanings.sent3: After a long day, I consume a juicy watermelon to refresh myself.
meanings.sent4: Her hunger was so intense that she seemed to consume the entire meal in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The hungry bear would consume anything edible in its path.

meanings.definition: To use up or deplete a resource
meanings.sent1: The factory's production process consumes a lot of energy.
meanings.sent2: We must be mindful not to consume all the natural resources too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner seemed to consume all the water stations along the route.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire rapidly consumed the forest, leaving behind ashes.
meanings.sent5: The growing population consumes more food each year.

meanings.definition: To completely destroy or engulf by fire
meanings.sent1: The flames quickly consumed the old wooden house.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire consumed acres of land in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent3: The campfire consumed the marshmallows, turning them golden brown.
meanings.sent4: The dragon's fiery breath consumed the entire village.
meanings.sent5: The fire danced as it consumed everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To absorb or take in mentally or emotionally
meanings.sent1: She was consumed by the thrilling plot of the book.
meanings.sent2: The artist was consumed by inspiration, creating masterpiece after masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: His mind was consumed by thoughts of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset consumed her senses, leaving her in awe.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody consumed the audience, evoking deep emotions.
